name: places/ChIJGWZmvldYwokR7wtDUuiKj1M
adrFormatAddress: 888 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Store offering shipping, packaging, printing & other services, plus office supplies.

originalText.text: I came in to have some important documents notarized and I was helped by an amazing representative named Ashley. She was kind, patient, and really helpful. Everyone who works in this store is friendly and goes out of their way to help you.

text.text: I came in to have some important documents notarized and I was helped by an amazing representative named Ashley. She was kind, patient, and really helpful. Everyone who works in this store is friendly and goes out of their way to help you.

originalText.text: I've always received courteous and patient customer service at this location, even when I had a huge bag of Amazon returns to scan. They don't dawdle either. One of the guys also went out of his way to find me some extra box lids that my kid's teacher requested we ask around for.

text.text: I've always received courteous and patient customer service at this location, even when I had a huge bag of Amazon returns to scan. They don't dawdle either. One of the guys also went out of his way to find me some extra box lids that my kid's teacher requested we ask around for.

originalText.text: Walked in to return a package, for which I had an electronic return label on my phone. UPS charges $4 to print a simple return label (single black and white page), and for that price you have to log into a computer and print it yourself. By comparison, FedEx prints any of their electronic labels for free, and only charges 20 cents to print a single page (20x cheaper than UPS!!). Also, UPS staff (in Midtown Manhattan) are almost always rude, aloof and/or unhelpful—I tend to have much better experiences at places like FedEx or even USPS.

originalText.text: This UPS location never opens on time. Why say you open at 8 AM? Its a lie. 8:30 AM, 8:45 AM, you are still not open. And when you do open-- there is never an apology or great customer service. Its like we are an inconvenience to you not the other way around. This is my 2nd time going to this location and my last. I rather go to 57th Street.

originalText.text:
I walked in with a partial email from Verizon to have it printed or haven’t managed by someone there for me to return this product back to Verizon. The manager came over while I he was still on his phone, looking at his phone and not doing customer service and pointing at the desktop instead of him coming around the counter and showing me how to do self which was unnecessary because I’ve done this before and all I had to do was actually just forward the email to the store email for them to print the UPS receipt to be mailed back to Verizon.

This young man, polite kind in South broken he had braids and he was such a gentleman his mother, his parents it’s such a great job for him to look at me and with my puzzle frustrated log tell me you can actually send your email to our store. Email at 4959. Whatever it was and he finished the transaction for me politely, someone should have a talk with his manager. He is rude in different and a present.

However, this gentleman who help me with the braids whoever he was, he was fantastic, patience, and engaging
